contentrichtext.text: '''Xmortis''' is a monthly [[Goth subculture|goth]] [[Club night|night]], held on the second Friday of the month, in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]]. ==History== Xmortis was started in July of 2004. The event was founded by Latex Lily<ref>http://thephoenix.com/BLOGS/eroticenquirer/archive/2008/04/03/1001-nights.aspx</ref> and Patman the Avenger, who, at the time, were a longtime couple in the [[Boston]] goth scene, their romance was featured in the [[Boston Globe]].<ref>http://www.boston.com/news/local/articles/2004/02/08/gothic_romance/</ref> Xmortis' predecessor was a goth event called ''Hell'' (known for its catchy title; event-goers could say they were "going to Hell"). ''Hell'' was held monthly at [[Manray]], Boston's best-known goth club, until the event ended in its 11th year. Xmortis continued the tradition at Manray, until the club's close in July 2005. Xmortis was then moved across the street, to the well-known rock club [[T.T. The Bear's Place]].<ref>[http://www.ttthebears.com/ T.T. The Bear's Place]</ref> Today, Xmortis continues its residency at TT's, with DJ [[Chris Ewen]] of the [[Future Bible Heroes]], Terri, the iconic [[Manray]] bartender, and a range of guest DJs. ==Themes== Though Xmortis is a goth night, the events typically feature a different theme each month. Past themes include ''X-Mortis'' (a comic book-themed night, the name is styled with the hyphen, a la [[X-Men]]),<ref>http://www.boston.com/ae/events/articles/2008/07/11/dancing_in_superhero_style/</ref> ''Monster A-Go-Go'' (a night of gothic greasers, and vintage horror), and ''Fashion Victims'', a night of gothic fashion shows.<ref>[http://www.boston.com/yourlife/fashion/articles/2004/11/11/beyond_the_pale/ Beyond the Pale], [[Boston Globe]]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.xmortis.com Xmortis], official site *[http://www.boston.com/news/globe/living/articles/2005/07/30/manrays_closing_leaves_a_hole_in_the_club_scene/ Manray's closing leaves a hole in the club scene]: Boston Globe article on Xmortis' transition to TT's, at the time of Manray's closing [[Category:Goth subculture]]
